title: CTRL0000071096 - Transcribed Interview of Frank Marchisella, (Apr. 29, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:36 a.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
M r - Let's go on the record at 10:36.
Today is April 29th, 2022, and we're here for the transcribed
interview of Mr. Frank Marchisella conducted by the House Select Committee to
Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House
I'm an investigative counsel with the select committee.
And at this time I'd ask the witness to please state your full name and spell your
And then, this is a staff-led interview.
for the Webex and have the option of joining today.
if a member of the committee comes into the Webex, I'll alert you to that and let you
know that we've got additional people on the call.
I don't foresee that happening, but
There are no other staff members on the call.
let you know if another staff member, like another lawyer from the committee, like me,
And then I'll ask -- so ask counsel to state their names for the record.
And Cindy Crick with Cindy Crick Law, C-r-i-c-k.
And then, Frank, just a few housekeeping matters before
I know last time we talked, it was a little more informal.
got some official reporters that'll be transcribing everything that we say.
So to make their job a little bit easier, let's just try to make sure to let
me finish my question before you start your answer so that we're not talking over each
It's pretty hard for them to record two people talking at the same time.
And then, also, sort of on the same theme, they can only
So make sure that we're not using like a head nod or a uh-huh or
Just a yes or a no or a complete sentence.
And then, today, just asking you to provide complete answers to the best of your
Knowing that we've spoken previously, we're really just trying to get to the
truth here, the best answer that you've got today.
if last time you told us the car was red and today you said it was maroon.
Don't get hung up on these kind of fine details.
I'm not concerned about, you know,
And just, if your memory is fuzzy, just let me know, and we can deal with that
when we get to it and, if you don't recall the answer to a question, just say "I don't recall."
And then, I'm also always happy to rephrase a
question or provide some sort of clarification if you don't understand what I'm asking
And then, also, I'll try to take a break about every hour.
that we'll go about 2 hours today.
me know, or if you need a break to talk to your counsel, I'm happy to do that as well.
And if you need a break at a different time, just let
And then, also, just another warning -- and this is a reminder
that we provide all witnesses that we talk to, but that it is unlawful to provide a false
statement to a congressional investigator like myself.
interview, providing false information could result in criminal penalties for false
Do you understand that, or have you had a discussion with your lawyers about
And so for the purposes of this
Then, with that, I think we'll start just with a little bit about your
Could you first actually just tell me your age?
And then what -- what do you do careerwise?
And then, am I right -- or why don't you tell me, any military
But you have a -- you've worked as a bouncer, I believe, right?
And then, why don't you just start with telling me how you came to
find out about the Oath Keepers and then came to join the organization.
I believe it was -- if I'm not mistaken, I believe it was on the news, and just
went to their website and joined.
November of -- it was the year the --
And was your interest in the Oath Keepers related to
Just the protection of people and property.
And had you been seeing things around that time that gave you
What sort of got you interested in the Oath Keepers?
On the news, you know, same thing everybody else was
places burning; houses burning; cars burning, destroyed; people getting beat,
And so those are kind of related to the -- some of the protests, a lot of the
racial justice protests that were happening over the summer of 2020?
Not --1 wasn't really looking at the racial part
And then -- so you said you found the Oath Keepers online.
And was it a news report?
Yeah, I think it was a news report.
I can't remember where they were.
And where was that news report?
I think -- I think the news was Virginia.
No, it was -- I think it was TV.
And do you recall what was being reported about them?
Was it like an -- it was like an online news source?
activity at a rally or something?
And then -- so you find the Oath Keepers website, and what
And so how did you go about actually joining?
I typed it in and up come a website.
I researched a little bit and found out it was military and law enforcement,
Felt like it was a good group at the time.
It was like, you know, joining anything
It was pretty basic and simple.
Was it like an on line web form, or how did you --
It was a form, I believe, and you filled it out.
email back -- I believe it was an email -- yeah -- stating that they wanted my driver's
license and my CWP for, I guess, vetting.
And CWP, is that conceal -- a concealed carry permit?
And do you know what was done to vet you, or did anybody explain that
So after you were vetted, what happened at that point?
I paid the tuition, and then it wasn't long after that -- it
was like -- I'm not even saying a week.
And then we got an email saying, call to action
And let me just ask you quickly.
the tuition that they asked for.
You mentioned that you paid the dues or
If I'm not mistaken, I think it was $1,200.
And were you told at all what those dues would go towards?
Having been a member for, you know, a brief period of time, did you learn
about what your dues were going towards?
I never got no articles of anything until after all this was over.
-- proof at all that I was even a member till they sent me the articles.
When did you -- when did you end up receiving that?
I could pull -- I mean, I'm talking about not too long ago.
Oh, of this -- of 2020 -- 2022 I mean?
2021, but to the end of it.
And when you said -- when you say articles, what do you mean?
Oh, I -- this is going to sound hard to believe, but I never opened it.
was papers, and that was it.
I -- when I say open, I opened it, glanced in there.
No more interest in it whatsoever after that.
Do you by any chance still have that package?
I could look to see, but I don't -- I don't know.
-- know if I got it or throwed it away with the mail or what, no.
So just some sort of paperwork --
Cindy and Robert, if maybe we can follow up afterwards.
happens to still have that welcome package, we'd --
And then were you put in contact?
you received the call to action for the November 18th Atlanta rally.
How did you receive that call to action?
How did you -- I know you said
And so were you put on like an email listserv, or what
I guess it was with the membership when I put everything in.
Did you use ProtonMail with the Oath Keepers?
I don't know what ProtonMail is, sir.
So it was just your personal email address --
And then -- so that, I take it, was joining with the national Oath
But am I right that there's also the South Carolina chapter?
There was no different chapters at -- there -- that had nothing to
do -- it was all one, as far as I was concerned.
It's just the guys in the area met on the
I don't even know why they were calling it a
chapter, because it was a very brief time.
What -- let's go in just a little bit to how you met the other South Carolina
local guys and how -- how you -- to the extent you formed a group, how you started
Off the Oath Keeper chat room.
It was an open chat room.
basically, you get on there, and who's from South Carolina, stuff like that.
And which application was that chat room on?
It was on -- it was on the website.
It was on the Oath Keeper website.
So that was like an on line portal, not -- not the Signal chats that we'll
And then, about how many of the local group that you were meeting with,
about how many people was that?
And when was that first meeting?
Did the first meeting happen after the trip to Atlanta?
I believe it was earlier than Christmas.
I don't know the exact date.
Sometime around Christmas or earlier than Christmas?
We'll come back to that a little bit then.
go to the November 18th rally in Atlanta.
So tell me a little bit about that call to action.
Who did it come from and
I had no idea where it come from.
I did send you the thing, didn't I, the call to action?
It give a place where it was going to be
And then we drove there and basically parked in a parking lot, and then
met -- there was another Oath Keeper there in the parking lot.
And we told him -- we walked up to him and said, We're new Oath Keepers.
And they said, Go to the steps of the capitol.
And so we made our way there, and that's where I met Stewart on the steps of the
They said, Stewart will be there.
And how many -- you said we drove down.
Oh, it was me and Dave Kirk, and my wife drove with us.
Can you tell me about Dave Kirk?
That's a friend of mine I've known for several years.
Who did you drive down with?
my tae kwon do instructor years ago, and just became friends and worked -- we worked
But he -- he's military and he was a police
What was his history, to the extent you knew it -- know it, with the Oath
How did he know of the Oath Keepers?
Well, I don't -- he said he was a member prior when he lived in Oregon.
I mean, that's all I know.
So he had -- so he had joined the Oath Keepers a while back --
But I mean -- I never knew it.
When I told him that I had joined, he said,
And so he sort of became active again in the Oath Keepers once you had
And did you tell him about that call to action and that you were going to be
And he just decided that sounded fun or something, like, he wanted to get
involved in and came with you?
And then, so you travel to Atlanta on the 18th, the three
of you -- you, your wife, and Mr. Kirk.
And do you recall who the other Oath Keeper that
you met in that parking lot or parking garage was?
And Kellye, the attorney for Rob -- Stewart.
Have you heard -And there was other Oath
Keepers there, but I didn't -- I don't remember -- know their names.
About how many other Oath Keepers were there for that event?
Between 9 and 11, put it that way, to be safe.
And then, were there -- of that kind of 9 to 11 Oath Keepers, anybody else
that you later ran into at other events, like either January 6th or any other Oath Keeper
Now, how was that question, sir?
Of that group that was in Atlanta --
-- did you later see any of them at other Oath Keeper events, like are they
people that you ran into again?
I only seen them one other time, and that was in D.C.
And it was all of that group?
but I can't remember his name.
There was a gentleman -- he was a
He was an Oath Keeper from Florida,
But he was -- I know that he had an online marketing
And I'm trying to remember his name, and I
Anyway, he -- I did see him in Atlanta and I did see him in D.C.
I seen Whip, Kellye, and -- and Stewart.
Were -- this gentleman that you were describing from Florida, were the
other Oath Keepers that were there also from Florida or from all over?
Did not know where none of them were from.
couple there -- I am pretty sure that a couple of them there were from Georgia, because
they seemed to know the streets and what -- you know, where everything was.
So when you arrived, Kellye and Whip told you to head towards the
Kellye and Whip and Stewart were already there.
Keeper -- don't know his name -- that was in the parking lot.
And when I -- I approached him, because he had Oath Keeper patch,
and I asked him -- I says, where -- I'm new.
You know, where -- you know, where do we
He said, Stewart's on the steps of the capitol.
And then we walked over to -- that's when we met Stewart, Whip, and Kellye --
-- and other Oath Keepers, but I don't know their names.
And so that was the first time you had met Mr. Rhodes, right?
Asked my name, asked me -- he said, What's your background?
And I said, Lewis, South Carolina.
So we stood there, me and Dave.
maybe 20 minutes, came back and said, All right.
the corner -- down at the -- there was a corner down from the capitol.
And how did that meeting go?
What did he say to you?
He said, Where are you from?
And then he left about maybe, I don't know,
I want you and Dave to go down on
stand there and watch, see if there's any activity or anything like that.
And that's where the Georgia State Police was and the Atlanta
They were all right there where we were standing.
that's -- that's the last time I seen Stewart till that afternoon, the evening.
And he came back when they were speaking -- where the speakers were
So for most of that day, you just kind of manned that corner and --
Well, I don't know about lookout.
Just see if anybody -- but I don't
know why I was there, because law enforcement was strong right there.
I want to ask you a little bit about other groups that you
Do you know who the Proud Boys are?
Yes, I know who the Proud Boys are.
And did you see any groups of Proud Boys there that day?
The only ones I could identify were ones called
76ers or 19 -- or 1776ers, because I -- the only reason why, because they had the patch.
First time I ever seen them in my life.
The 76ers, and there was -- oh, there was another
I can't remember the name of them.
because they didn't have no patches or emblems on.
Couldn't tell if they were Proud Boys,
They actually had a flag that they were holding, but I can't
The 1 percent or 2 percent or something like that.
The Three Percenters, I believe, yes, sir.
They were there, because I remember their insignia.
For the Proud Boys, normally they wear black and yellow are the
And a lot of times they'll march kind of in a group.
remember seeing a group wearing prominently yellow or black?
If I did, I didn't -- I didn't register to me.
So after you spent some time on that corner just kind of
watching what was going on, what did you guys do for the rest of the day?
Well, I know -- I can't -- I don't know if it was the Atlanta State Police or the
we could help -- the speakers were over, they asked if we could help clear the streets.
And then that's when we, you know, helped, just asked people to move along and wrap
They came up to us -- me and Dave was standing there, and they asked if
And do you recall about what time that might have been?
Oh, it was still sunny, so I'm going to guess.
guess at this and say between 5:00, maybe 6 o'clock.
I have no idea, but I'm going to
And did you arrive early in the morning, or when did you get to
It was probably -- it was about lunchtime.
Did you see any of the speakers that day?
Everybody else -- when I got there, there was
a lady speaking, but I have no idea her name or even listened to what she was saying.
On that day, there was sort of an event where some of the speakers,
including -- well, actually, let me first ask you:
Do you know who Ali Alexander is?
I met him, but not at the time, sir.
couldn't even know his name or what he looked like.
If you want -- you want a time line,
At that time, I had no idea who this was.
But what I was going to ask -- oh, and then, also, are you familiar with
So at that time, you didn't know.
After -- after -- when everybody went to the hotel room, that's where I met
So we'll come to that in one second.
Do you know who that is?
Well, what I was going to ask you was, there was a group of
individuals who were speakers at the event.
Ali Alexander is one of those people.
Alex Jones -- I recognize you don't know who he is -- is another.
entered the capitol on that day.

Was not aware of that whatsoever.
And this wasn't like the January 6th event.
It was -- it was just some of the speakers going into the
When I got there, sir, the capitol was barricaded, and there was police
20, 30 minutes before we got moved down to the corner.
Could you describe just sort of the mood of that day?
The steps leading to the capitol is where we were at -- for
So not like -- you know, nothing like the January 6th events?
And then sorry to repeat this question, I think, but you said you did
microphones, but I couldn't make out what -- nothing what they were saying, and I really
Then, so after you helped clear some of the -- one of the
street ways after the speeches, tell me what happened after that.
So when you were all present together, did Mr. Rhodes tell you to download
We stayed there till later that night too, just patrolling the streets until
Everybody met back in that same parking lot from where we first
And then that's where Stewart -- that's where we all stood there and we got
I didn't even know what Signal was, and got the Signal on our phones.
And what was the purpose of downloading Signal at that time?
everybody was cleared and got in their cars.
And at some point, was there also -- did you go to a -- like a hotel

That was at -- when we finally -- everything was finished.
We went to the hotel lobby where they were having drinks and stuff like that there.
And there was all kinds of people there.
Did that happen -- you just described that after you downloaded Signal, for a

And what were you doing when you were -- when you were doing
Just making sure that everybody made it to their cars and make sure that

Did anybody tell you what you were, like, protecting against as you were
taking people to their cars or --
Let's just pause -- Mr. Marchisella, let's just pause for one
second until or after I finish my question before you start speaking, and I'll try to not
So you said that you were watching out or trying to prevent any violence or
anything happening to folks as they were walking to their car.
was going to cause that violence?
Had no idea who, where, what.
Just it would -- they -- you know, if you
looked at the TV, it was coming from everywhere.
Can't identify no -- no group or a
Did Mr. Rhodes say anything about what you should watch out for, or did he
just say walk these people to their cars?
Just walk -- walk to the cars.
He never looked -- he never said look out for
And so when you finished that, that's when you went to
And tell me about the hotel lobby.
I seen a lot of different people, a lot of Oath Keepers.
Three Percent, there was people there, Three Percent.
Is that what you called them
I think that is the name of one of the groups, yeah.
And that's basically where I met

And he came over -- it was to a group of Oath Keepers?
Did he come over to a group of Oath Keepers to thank them?
Really, I sat in the lobby -- me and my wife just sat there alone basically, and
You know, there was nothing happened here.
going on here, you know what I'm saying?
And we never engaged, really, in any of the little groups
I mean, I was like, what --1 don't even know what's
Everybody's talking and shaking hands and
And that's when Mr. Ali there came over where we were sitting, shook hands, said
Thank you for -- you know, the security, and stuff like that.
That's how I recognized his face and his name.
And anybody else that was sort of, you know, a notable person or famous

Don't know his name, but there was a blond-haired gentleman that was with
him in a suit and tie.
assuming, but it seemed to be of importance.
And never seen him before, but he seemed to be -- again, I'm
But he was blond-haired, young guy.
I was going to ask -- I thought maybe when you said

Do you know who Roger Stone is?
I couldn't identify Roger Stone right now.
And what was this lobby meeting?
Was it just like a cocktail hour
Let's actually just go off the
I wanted to ask you again just quickly about the Proud Boys.
said that you couldn't identify them there, but did you say you knew they were there?
I heard guys talking that there was some Proud Boys there and basically -- I
And how did you know that they were there?
never heard of the Three Percenters or the 76ers till that day.
And what were folks saying about the Proud Boys?
Nothing you could put a top on.
And then, for Mr. Roger Stone, let me just clarify that too.
say you would not recognize Roger Stone if you saw him?
I -- I don't -- I don't know Roger Stone.
In other words, they -- again, I
heard later, after the -- you hear the names, that he was there.
After Mr. Rhodes told you to download Signal, was he also at that
Did you talk to him at all on that occasion?
It was a -- as a group.
He was talking to guys as a group,
just saying thanks, good job, and, you know, stuff like that.
So let's talk a little bit about your interactions with Mr. Rhodes, either
communications on Signal or phone calls after that Atlanta rally.
time that you remember talking to Mr. Rhodes?
I heard that he drove by
And if I did, I didn't know it was him.
It was, I believe, if I'm not mistaken, it was Signal or a phone call.
asking if we could find local members.
And so he wanted you basically to start recruiting --
And did he explain, you know, why that was or what he was trying to do?
No, sir, because the only thing I was thinking was getting more members.
And I just wanted to ask -- I forgot to ask earlier.
you initially paid dues, it was about $1,200.
Do you know when -- do you know if David paid that lifetime dues amount?
And then, so Mr. Rhodes basically asked you to grow the numbers of the

Not -- not -- nobody was really interested.
I think -- the only person that

Some of the -- all the guys that I knew there

I just talked to guys I know that was military or law enforcement, like that.
they were, no, not at this time.
I didn't give it a whole lot of attention, but I did ask people, and
So no new members, but you guys did start again to meet with some
regularity on Mondays, I think you said?
I attended -- I attended five meetings.
Not to be -- no pun intended, but, like I said, it was like being at the VFW on
And just tell me about those meetings.
Mostly talking about their experiences in the military or law
So they're sharing war stories and fishing stories?
And I sat there like a lump on a log.
I even told my wife, I said,
I'm going to go a couple more of these and I ain't going back, because I'm just -- I can't

There was talks about politics and the election.
The same old regurgitated stuff you
Nothing that really stands out to me.
And can you tell me what, if any, what feelings you had about the election
and what your involvement in politics was at that time?
Never been involved in politics in my life.
registered to vote in my life.
ignorant about this, but I was as new as new could get.
It was the first time I ever
I mean -- I mean, I hate to sound so
Did Mr. Rhodes join for any of your Monday meetings?
And when -- how many times did he do that?
Do you recall when that was?
Right before December -- right before we went up December.
Was he there in person or did he call in?
If you look at the Monday before the 6th, that was the date.
And I think you said right before you went up in December.
mean right before you went up in January?
So Wednesday -- January 6th was a Wednesday, so January 4th was the
And let's -- well, one thing I'll ask you actually.
conversation with Mr. Rhodes again about recruitment, like about the fact that you
Well, he was basically nonchalant about that.
I did say, you know -- he said, You got any new members?
I said, Everybody that's here has been members already.
And how big was that group that came together to meet on Mondays?
Anywhere from three to five guys.
And let's talk about that January 4th meeting that Mr. Rhodes
What was the topic of that meeting or what did you guys discuss that day?
He was main -- mostly concerned about who was going to the -- to the
When had you all started discussing the possibility of going up for
When they sent that -- a call -- that call -- the alert call out on email.
And how did you talk with the other local guys about going up?
Signal, phone, text, just normal stuff like that that was local.
And who -- if we can go through for the names that you remember,
can you tell me who the local guys were that --
-- were going to go up for the 6th?

Why don't we -- let me -- I am going to pull up

just tell me if this is a pretty complete or close to complete list.

January 4th from a man named Stephen Brown, who is part of a company called Resource

want me to zoom in a little bit?

Bruce, Bob, Darin, David, and you.

And what did Mr. Rhodes tell you about that work?
what you should do to prepare to provide security?

What else did you talk about at the January 4th meeting?
protection equipment and stuff like this.
wear Oath Keeper patches, as many as we could put on.
And, oh, we were definitely encouraged to
That's what -- that's what Stewart Rhodes said out of his own

And there were different group chats that you could -- that you can join or

that sometimes you were added to.

sure about exactly how that works.

Well, I don't think it was all related to the State.
like, who the groups that were going, or who was going.
